meanings.definition: A person who is not an actor.
meanings.sent1: The school play had many talented actors and one nonactor in the background.
meanings.sent2: The movie audition attracted both experienced actors and nonactors.
meanings.sent3: During the casting call, the director jokingly asked if there were any nonactors trying out.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of performers, he felt like a nonactor, simply observing from the sidelines.
meanings.sent5: She stood out as a nonactor among the seasoned cast members, but she quickly learned and improved.

meanings.definition: Something that is not an actor.
meanings.sent1: The prop on stage was just a nonactor, but it added to the scene's authenticity.
meanings.sent2: The costume designer had to consider every detail, even the nonactors in the background.
meanings.sent3: The director accidentally left a nonactor prop on stage, causing confusion during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The nonactor object stood silently on the set, enhancing the overall atmosphere of the play.
meanings.sent5: Among the actors and actresses, the nonactor prop played a crucial role in setting the scene.
